name: ITP - 129 - Pavement Type 6 (Maintenance Track)
template name: ITP - 129 - Pavement Type 6 (Maintenance Track) Rev B

name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
4.01.01 - SIL Maximum Dry Density & Optimum - Moisture Content
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The GAP65 and GAP40 IANZ Accredited laboratory for Maximum Dry Density & Optimum Moisture Content
Frequency - 1 test per material type and no less than 1 test every 5,000m³ (in place)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - PSD, WQI, Crushing resistance, CI, PI, SE. Requirements to RITS 3.1.4.2 GAP aggregates.
Frequency - 1 test per material type and no less than 1 test every 5,000m³ (in place)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Test results for undercut backfill prior to bulk fill commencing, NDM, scala penetrometer, shear vane or cleggs, material dependant. TBC instruction from engineer. Undercut backfill QA to be filed/captured separately from bulk earthworks fill QA.
Frequency - Prior to bulk fill commencing

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Scalar Pentrometer testing completed at 20m intervals at a depth of 1.0m and proof rolling if deemed pratical as per Geotechnical Works Specification. Failure of either test method will result in a 300mm undercut of the subgrade. Included target of CBR >7% as per DWG notes.
Verifying Document - Site Record, Scalar Test Results
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 300mm undercut to be inspected, on cohesive materials shear veins are to be completed with a target of >70KPa.
Frequency - Every Undercut and Prior to Undercut Backfill
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GAP subgrade hard fill shall be tested via back scatter. NDM direct transmission with probe depth of 300mm with granular materials.

○ 98% average MDD, 95% minimium MDD. Survey shot at each test location, point ID to be agreed upon by contractor/sub-contractor to match test number, each test lift not to exceed 500mm thick. Proof Roll Completed prior to subbase.
Verifying Document - NDM Test Results / Proof Roll
Frequency - Every Undercut Prior to Pavement & Proof Roll 100% of layer
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GAP65 subbase shall be tested via back scatter.
○ 95% average and 92% minimium. Survey shot at each test location, point ID to be agreed upon by contractor/sub-contractor to match test number. Proof Roll completed prior to placing basecourse.
Verifying Document - NDM Test Results / Proof Roll
Frequency - 5 tests per 1000m2 & Proof Roll 100% of layer
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GAP40 basecourse fill shall be tested by back scatter.
○ 95% average and 92% minimium. Survey shot at each test location, point ID to be agreed upon by contractor/sub-contractor to match test number. Final Proof Roll and inspection.
Verifying Document - NDM Test Results / Proof Roll
Frequency - 5 tests per 1000m2 & Proof Roll 100% of layer
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Compile construction records for final submission ensuring defects (NCRs) / Snags / missing records are captured or closed out, all tests have been received and passed, and changes / omissions have been noted.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting including, initial subgrade level, all undercuts, all test location points, and final level
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Create a set of Redline Drawings for Asbuilt creation noting all changes and departures in red pen.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Update the project Defect, Snag and Punch List Register
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum subgrade, undercuts, all service ducting/pipe lines immediately before backfill, warning tape / mag slabs immediately before backfill.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
